content.p: For each scenario, identify the variable as either quantitative or categorical.

body.p: 1) A poll of students at your college asks each student to give an estimate of the number of military causalities that have occurred since the United States invaded Iraq in March of 2003.

response.feedback: Correct. The variable is the estimate of the number of military casualties. It is quantitative. So this type of scenario will be analyzed using means, not proportions.
Incorrect. The variable is the estimate of the number of military casualties. It is quantitative. So this type of scenario will be analyzed using means, not proportions.

body.p: 2) A poll of students at your college shows that 2 out of 3 do not support continuing military intervention in Iraq.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The variable is support (or not) for continuing military intervention. It is categorical. So this type of scenario will be analyzed using proportions.
Correct. The variable is support (or not) for continuing military intervention. It is categorical. So this type of scenario will be analyzed using proportions.

body.p: 3) A local newspaper claims that 67% of the county's residents support a bond measure. We conduct a phone survey and find that 85 out of the 150 people contacted support the measure.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The variable is support (or not) for a bond measure. It is categorical. So this type of scenario will be analyzed using proportions.
Correct. The variable is support (or not) for a bond measure. It is categorical. So this type of scenario will be analyzed using proportions.

body.p: 4) A local newspaper claims that the county's residents commute an average of 18 miles each way to work. We conduct a phone survey in which we ask the number of miles the respondent drives each way to work.

response.feedback: Correct. The variable is number of miles commuted each way to work. It is quantitative. So this type of scenario will be analyzed using means, not proportions.
Incorrect. The variable is number of miles commuted each way to work. It is quantitative. So this type of scenario will be analyzed using means, not proportions.
